Russia bets on sports to regain international standing
subhead: Moscow has scored back-to-back victories. Its judokas can now compete worldwide with flag and anthem, and its skiers are eligible for the Olympics. To bring its athletes back, Moscow has focused on legal battles and 'sharp power,' a variant of soft power.

Trump administration approves $11 billion weapons sales to Taiwan
subhead: The sale is the second since Donald Trump returned to office, and it comes after Taiwan's president vowed to increase defense spending in the face of ongoing military pressure from China.

title: EU-backed convention establishes commission to compensate Ukraine for Russian crimes
subhead: Thirty-four countries, joined by the European Union, have adopted, under the aegis of the Council of Europe, a convention creating a mechanism to compensate for the harm caused by the war waged by Moscow since February 2022.

title: Max Walker-Silverman's 'Rebuilding' tells the story of a cowboy's struggles after a tragic fire
subhead: Actor Josh O'Connor delivers a standout performance in the film, which follows a man reconnecting with his daughter after losing his job and sense of self in the blaze that destroyed his ranch.

title: AstraZeneca CEO Pascal Soriot: 'The pharmaceutical industry in Europe will be reduced to a shadow of itself within 15 years'
subhead: The head of the pharmaceutical giant warns that Europe's decline in manufacturing innovative medicines is likely to accelerate as a result of the policies pursued by Donald Trump. According to Soriot, all new factories producing the medicines of tomorrow will be built across the Atlantic.

'It is easier to flatter the people than to serve. Therein lies the last obstacle to an RN victory in 2027'
subhead: Populism has never been stronger in France, but there is a crucial difference between flattering the people and serving them, and the Rassemblement National is currently stumbling on that divide, writes Le Monde columnist Françoise Fressoz.

title: A French farmer's distress: 'I found the first dead cow when I went to the pasture'
subhead: Near Benque, a village an hour from Toulouse, farmer Christian Lasserre discovered three carcasses on Saturday. He fears a new outbreak of lumpy skin disease and the culling of the entire herd.

title: New York's community kitchens reveal the American cost-of-living crisis
subhead: In the world's largest economy, where prices for consumer goods, including food, have soared since the Covid-19 pandemic, 41 million people rely on government-issued food stamps to have enough to eat every day.
